reviews.content: We had our first appointment with Dr. Biggers yesterday, and what a fantastic appointment.  I don't remember ever having a doctor listen to the patient and take his time like he did.  He was so warm and gave us so much information.  I HIGHLY recommend him.  We have received great service from the office staff also for paper work and orders for care.

Horrible service!!!! If you feel terrible and have a few hours, literally a few hours!!!! to waste, go see them!. I had an appointment for 4:20- got there at 4:10, waited, waited, waited some more, then I was called back at 5:05.. So, I sat in the room for about ten minutes, blood pressure was taken then guess what I did.... WAITED!!! At 5:45 I walked out!!! The nurse said " it will only be about twenty more minutes "!!!!! Are you serious!!!. Avoid at all costs!!! Don't waste your time when you need help!. Frustrated and fed up with poor service.....

I have been a patient of Dr. Biggers when he had a receptionist, a couple techs and an older lady in billing you saw on the way out... My how that seems like such a long time ago. Now his wife Dr Elizabeth is on board and some new Nurse Practitioners and a Physician Assistant. I could not be more thrilled with the level of care I have recieved here... The new PA Mr. Wilson aka "Justin" as he likes to be called is awesome. His bedside manner is excellent and he really cares about the patients, not just pushing you out the door. He is a great addition to the Biggers Practice...    As for the receptionists I have never had a problem.. I do see them being mistreated all the time and they are just as courteous as can be while having a smile on their face. If someone treated me like that I'd go off in a heartbeat, so I respect them a lot. People only see things one sided but I am here to tell u that Dr Biggers and his staff deserve the upmost respect. Thanks again for such excellent care.

This is no reflection of Dr. Joel as he has been nothing but fantastic with me and my family. However the front office staff is rude and not very attentive.  Made this appointment a month ago online.  Appointment 2:40 - Been sitting now for 54 min and have had 4 people go back to see the Dr while I'm sitting here. Make the at 5 as they just pulled someone else back.  I'm sitting right in front of the door and no one sees or realized I'm still sitting here. I want to become a asshole but I'm just gonna sit and see how long it takes.. Make that 6 people that have signed in after me and got in... time 3:38.... Exactly one hour and finally got called in.

Consider a different office. The doctor may be phenomenal (I wouldn't know) but the people they hire to answer their phones might as well work at a collection agency because when you call to make an appointment they are DRY. Might as well be robots taking your call. I would NEVER recommend a doctors office where ALL the staff does not treat each individual as a person, Instead of a number. If I wanted to go be treated like an insurance card with skin. I'd go to the emergency room.

I am rating this Doctors office only because of Linda and Brandi, let me start by saying the front desk staff sucks! They are rude, lack a personality, and far from empathetic. Definitely not a staff that should work in any doctors office. However once you get past the ugly... the people that work in the back office is so pleasant, friendly, warm and welcoming. I am a new patient at this practice and if it wasn't for Brandi being there I would be gone already! If you are looking for a medical professional that has a GREAT personality, and a great attitude, and what appears to be great practices, see Brandi! The Doctors at this office may very well be amazing but I have not seen them... lastly if you ever need blood drawn, Yolanda is the person to do it, I am terrified of needles and her attitude, sense of humor, and assurance is all you need to have your blood drawn comfortably.

Dr. Joel and Dr. Elizabeth are great, however their office staff is very rude and disrespectful. I have experienced in person and on the phone, they act like the patient is an inconvenience to their day. The office needs to get a clue...we are your customers. We help the Biggers afford to pay your paycheck. If we do not come you will not have a job. . Some advise to the Biggers, fire your entire office staff and start new. Not a one of them (beside the Phleb) is worth whatever you are paying them. Absolutely horrific customer service!

My experience with Dr. Biggers has been limited thus far - just my initial appointment and physical wellness check-up.  His staff is friendly and knowledgeable and he himself is very good at speaking to patients and putting things in relatable terms.. I *hope* I don't have to go back soon...but if I do, I feel like I am in good hands with Dr. Biggers as my primary care physician.

I am brand new to the area and left behind an amazing family physician of 4 yrs and prior to him was yet another amazing family physician of 16+ yrs so any doc here has a high bar to meet.  I had previously met another MD to interview and before we even spoke about why I was there or what I expected,  I in very clear terms told him he was not anyone I was interested in working with. He was rude, arrogant,  and felt his time far more valuable than mine.  So back to the drawing board,  I came across Dr. Joel. I took a chance and while we may not have hit it off personality wise,  ( he's very nice just unique ) I quickly realized he was a true physician. He cares about his patients and doing what is best for them. He took over 3 hours of his day that day to help me out,  a virtual stranger.  He went above and beyond what most any other physician would even have bothered to do.  He was honest,  direct,  and unapologetic for doing things the right way.  Patients don't need to hear what they want to hear,  or to be placated, or to have some distorted version of the truth given to them. No,  patients need an honest,  ethical,  straight forward,  compassionate physician. I'm not looking for a best friend,  I'm looking for and honest physician who advocates for his patients,  who advocates for what is right and just, and that's exactly what I found in Dr. Joel. Not to mention the nice lady who checks u out, she is so sweet.  . I look forward to cultivating a strong professional relationship moving forward.

Very disappointed in this practice. For being my family doctor, they sure don't care about seeing their patients when they need an appointment (and I rarely need an appointment). It doesn't matter if you're in pain and only have a very limited time frame that you can actually secure childcare. They will not work with you, the least. They are always booked full and getting seen is impossible. Or maybe it's, just because I'm on state insurance and they don't want to take too many of those kind of patients? Regardless I feel with their lack of service and poor scheduling my health is being affected. Also the majority of the receptionist are rude. They have heavy attitudes and are quick to get you off the phone. I need to find a new family doctor and I suggest you look else where if you actually want to be seen, not to mention the 3 month waiting period to get in if you're a new patient.

This review is purely for the front staff. I called to book an appt as a new patient. She answers and I ask if they are accepting new patients (as my insurance website listed them as), she rudely told me to hold and I'm pretty sure I heard her eyes actually roll. I held for about 2 minutes and when she came back, she said (again, with the attitude as if I was interrupting something more important) "what was the question?". I repeated myself, she put me on hold again, and at this point I was pretty sure I didn't want to even make the appointment because of her lack of professionalism - if just a simple question was this hard, what could I expect from actually having to deal with appointments and billing? When she came back, less than 30 seconds later, so at least it was a short hold, she said "yeah, we are. But no new appointments until June" with such contempt I wondered if I had personally offended her! I just thanked her and hung up. I'm okay with waiting (i actually made an appt else where and it's not until July), but the utter lack of respect for a complete stranger and potential new patient, was uncalled for. I'm sure they have lost plenty of business because of the front staff. I honestly would have given a 1 star, but since I didn't actually meet with the doctor, I didn't want to totally drag down her rating, so I figured 3 was a good split.

I selected Biggers Family Medicine as my primary care when I enrolled in Humana at the beginning of 2015. Thankfully, I had no need to make an appointment until December.  I arrived on time for my appointment only to be refused service.  It's 4 days before Christmas and no way was I able to get a new patient appointment anywhere else.  They have zero compassion and poor office skills.
Saw Dr. Elizabeth she was very good and took the time to ask me questions and listen. The nurses also very polite and caring. You call they call you back.
I was very disappointed with this office. The doctor was very condescending and belittles the patients. Also, expect to pay up front for services even though it is covered by your insurance.

I am a recent patient of Dr.Biggers. I found him to be friendly, courteous and the utmost professional answering all my questions. He is an example of what physicians are supposed to be when it comes to patient care. He shared step by step what was happening, why and what to expect during treament.  I would recommend Dr. Biggers if you are seeking primary care physican.
